newsitem.title: INDIA: India Infosys for raising FII holding.
newsitem.headline: India Infosys for raising FII holding.

text.p: The board of directors of software major Infosys Technologies Ltd said it recommended an increase in foreign institutional investors' (FII) holding in the firm to 30 percent from 24 percent.

"The board has recommended an increase in the limit of FII/NRIs (non-resident Indian)/OCB (overseas corporate bodies) investment from 24 percent to 30 percent based on the recent announcement by the government to that effect," it said.
The raising of the limit of foreign investors' holding in Indian firms was announced in the 1997/98 (April-March) budget presented to the parliament on February 28.
Infosys, one of India's leading software makers, is a favourite among FIIs.
At a board meeting on Tuesday, the company announced a net profit of 369.8 million rupees, inclusive of an extraordinary income of 35.9 million rupees, for 1996/97 (April-March).
The net profit during 1995/96 was 210.1 million rupees.
Infosys also announced a bonus issue of shares in the ratio of one for every share held at Tuesday's board meeting in the southern city of Bangalore.
The bonus offer would be placed before the shareholders for approval at an annual shareholders meeting on June 7.
